title: Packaging code and data for reproducible research: A case study of journey time statistics
analysis_techniques: Document analysis; Interviews; Research and development
research_description: This paper explores how governments can maximize the value of open data by packaging them in analysis-ready formats, with a case study of journey time statistics. It highlights the importance of reproducibility and transparency in public sector data use.
research_results: The study demonstrated that well-packaged data significantly reduce analysis time and errors. It also underscored the need for standardized formats across datasets.
future_research: Future work should focus on improving the efficiency of data formats and exploring the potential for using machine learning techniques to analyze these datasets.
